meanings.definition: The quality or state of being ancient.
meanings.sent1: The ancientry of the ruins fascinated the historians.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed artifacts that showcased the ancientry of the civilization.
meanings.sent3: The debate over who owned the ancientry of the land led to comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The ancientry of the castle walls whispered stories of battles long forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The ancientry of the forest enveloped visitors in a sense of timelessness.

meanings.definition: An ancient or old-fashioned style or manner.
meanings.sent1: Her dress was designed in an ancientry that harkened back to a bygone era.
meanings.sent2: The antique shop was filled with items that exuded an old-world ancientry.
meanings.sent3: The play's attempt to mimic the ancientry of Shakespearean language left the audience chuckling.
meanings.sent4: The ancientry of his speech transported listeners to a different time and place.
meanings.sent5: The ancientry of the music resonated with those who appreciated classical compositions.

meanings.definition: The collective body of ancient persons or things.
meanings.sent1: The ancientry of the artifacts in the museum provided a glimpse into the past.
meanings.sent2: Historians study the ancientry of civilizations to understand their development.
meanings.sent3: The ancientry of the group's traditions brought a sense of unity among its members.
meanings.sent4: In the library, the ancientry of books lined the shelves, each holding a piece of history.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the ancientry of the city revealed layers of stories waiting to be uncovered.
